author: sky.cactus
content: Post merge there is no need for a public PoW testnet.  I do think Ropsten should probably be the *last* testnet to go through The Merge, because it is the one that is *closest* to mainnet (with all of its historic baggage).

author: alexssd7fp
content: I assumed that you want to execute the merge on it before the mainnet merge

author: alexssd7fp
content: If you plan to make it after - then there is indeed no need for PoW testnet

author: sky.cactus
content: On a related note, I wonder if The Merge is the right time to spin up a mainnet fork testnet?  This would be a testnet where we just change network ID (but not chain ID) and lower the difficulty.  We would then mirror transactions from mainnet over to the testnet (the subset that remain compatible).  This would allow us to test with mainnet state history and close to mainnet transaction volume and shape.

author: sky.cactus
content: We specifically want mainnet transaction volume though, which means shared chain ID so we can mirror transactions over.

author: alexssd7fp
content: You can keep the same chain ID

author: alexssd7fp
content: Also do note that it is impossible to mirror the entire mainnet without somehow keeping the same tx ordering in the block

author: sky.cactus
content: The goal is to just have them be as *close* as possible to each other.
